Climate change: How a heating planet is charging up NZ’s big rain-makers https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/climate-change-how-a-heating-planet-is-charging-up-nzs-big-rain-makers/MFOH74A3MFEJRPWC4MZJANJYLY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/climate-change-how-a-heating-planet-is-charging-up-nzs-big-rain-makers/MFOH74A3MFEJRPWC4MZJANJYLY/ Jamie MortonDecades of rain data are giving scientists a wider picture of global warming's influence. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 23:43:16 +0000 Scientists have delved into decades of data to tease out global warming’s hidden hand in shifts in local rainfall patterns over New Zealand - offering a glimpse of what we can expect from storms of the future. Photo / Dean Purcell

Is there life on Mars? What NZ’s famous hot springs could tell us https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/is-there-life-on-mars-what-nzs-known-hot-springs-could-tell-us/3Y4UDQNI5VEEVKW5ZRXNE6V6RM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/is-there-life-on-mars-what-nzs-known-hot-springs-could-tell-us/3Y4UDQNI5VEEVKW5ZRXNE6V6RM/ Jamie MortonAotearoa's world-famous hot springs could help answer one of science’s biggest questions. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 23:18:56 +0000 There’s tantalising evidence – from ancient river valleys to key chemicals unearthed in Martian rock - suggesting Mars was much more habitable than it is today.
